affymetrix.calvin.data
Class DataSet

java.lang.Object
  affymetrix.calvin.data.DataSet

public class DataSet
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides methods to access the data of a DataSet.

Constructor Detail

DataSet

public DataSet(java.lang.String fileName_,
               DataSetHeader header_,
               java.io.FileInputStream handle_)
Constructor. Use this ctor to access the data using memory-mapping. On Windows, memory-mapping will be restricted to 200MB view of the DataSet data.

Parameters:
fileName_ - The name of the generic file to access.
header_ - The DataSetHeader of the DataSet to access.
handle_ - A handle to the file mapping object

getDataString8AsBytes

public byte[] getDataString8AsBytes(int row,
                                    int col)
                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                    UnsignedOutOfLimitsException
Reads an 8 bit string as an array of bytes. This retuns the same data as getDataString8(int, int), but avoids the expense of creating a String from the bytes. Using this method rather than getDataString8(int, int). requires that you understand a bit more about how the data is encoded. The length of the array will be exactly the declared length of the column in the data set. If any data value in the returned byte array is zero, that value and all subsequent values in the array should be ignored if you are going to interpret the data as a String.

Parameters:
b - The input file stream.
Returns:
The string read from the file stream.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
UnsignedOutOfLimitsException

bytesPerRow

public int bytesPerRow()
Return the bytes per row.

Returns:
Bytes in a row.

filePosition

public UInt filePosition(int rowStart,
                         int col)
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         UnsignedOutOfLimitsException
Returns the address of a data element given a row and column. Ensures that data from the given row is mapped.

Parameters:
rowStart - Row index
col - Column index
Returns:
Pointer to the data element at rowStart
Throws:
java.io.IOException
UnsignedOutOfLimitsException

filePosition

public UInt filePosition(int rowStart,
                         int col,
                         int rowCount)
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         UnsignedOutOfLimitsException
Returns the address of a data element given a row and column, relative to the start of the memory-mapped window. Ensures that data from rowStart to rowCount+rowStart are mapped unless that is larger than the mapped window.

Parameters:
rowStart - Row index
col - Column index
rowCount - The number of rows to ensure are mapped starting at rowStart
Returns:
Pointer to the data element at rowStart
Throws:
java.io.IOException
UnsignedOutOfLimitsException

getColumByteOffsets

public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getColumByteOffsets()
Returns an unmodifiable List of of the byte offsets to each column.

Returns:
an unmodifiable List
